config.question: How did relations between slaveowners and slaves on smaller estates differ from those on larger estates?

choices.content: Most of the small estate owners were free slaves.
Small estate owners were more influenced by a humanitarian spirit.
Interracial marriages took place on the smaller estates.
The slaveowners and the slaves worked together in the fields.

answer_3.response: Consider This: Most slaves chose to live on larger plantations. Slave testimony reveals that both the best and the worst of slavery could be found on small farms, depending on the character and disposition of the master. See L.O. 11.2 What divided and united white southern society?
